info.title: Delivery REST API
info.description:
# Introduction The Delivery API is a read-only REST API that serves published content from your Kontent.ai projects. Use the Delivery API to deliver large amounts of content to your website or app. The content is cached on the CDN level, which makes it quickly available from wherever you are. The Delivery API provides [content filtering](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) options that allow you to retrieve only the parts of the content you need. All requests to the API must be made securely over HTTPS with TLS 1.2. # Production vs. Preview You can work with the Delivery REST API in two modes: * Production – Get the published versions of content items. * Preview – Get the latest versions of content items. The latest version can come from both published and unpublished content items. In both cases, you use the same endpoints to request data but with a different base URL. To retrieve **published** content items from your project, use the **production** URL: `https://deliver.kontent.ai//items`
**Protect your content** The Delivery API is public by default. To protect your published content, use the Delivery API with secure access enabled.
To preview **latest version** of your content items from your project, use the **preview** URL: `https://preview-deliver.kontent.ai//items` If you want to preview the latest version of your content, you need to authorize your request. For the Delivery Preview API, you can use two concurrent API keys, Primary and Secondary. For more details on how to work with content preview, see [configuring preview](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/c62f9339-3ba4-4a02-98a3-f4920cb591be). # Authentication By default, the Delivery API does not require authentication. However, if you enable [secure access](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/312ecd2f-d37f-4055-82c2-ac912d0d4b8d) for the Delivery API or use the Delivery Preview API, you need to authenticate your requests with valid API keys. To get data from the Delivery API with secure access enabled or the Delivery Preview API, send your requests over HTTPS using the `Authorization` header in the following format: `Authorization: Bearer `. Requests with an incorrect or missing `Authorization` header will fail with an [error](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f80180f6-1cd0-4c4d-8b8c-2d7645f2f0f1). To get your API key, go to [Kontent.ai](https://app.kontent.ai/) > Project settings > API keys. The API keys provide access to a single Kontent.ai project. You will need different API keys for each of your projects.

x_request_charge_a9674e2.description:
Specifies the number of content items returned in the response. This number covers both the items that directly match the specified query and the linked items returned in the response's `modular_content` property.

If the `X-Request-Charge` value of your requests exceeds 1000, we recommend applying more specific [filters](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) and checking if a lower value for the [`depth` parameter](#tag/Linked-content-and-components/linked-content-depth) works for you. Fewer items returned per response means shorter response times and better performance for your app.

a6be9b2b_718f_015a_fc50_f182e78f6884.title: modular_content
a6be9b2b_718f_015a_fc50_f182e78f6884.description:
A dictionary of [components and linked items](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/286dbb0e-f673-494f-abfd-3f39c7ec3446).

**Note**: The items and components are not in any particular order.

b1528ffb_e3c5_0159_c830_6621bf89b95d.title: modular_content
b1528ffb_e3c5_0159_c830_6621bf89b95d.description: The collection of related Content item objects (including component objects).

b4ffa411_c84a_01a7_74a7_88930d2b3ce2.title: options
b4ffa411_c84a_01a7_74a7_88930d2b3ce2.description: The list of multiple choice options available for the element. The order of the option objects in the array matches the order of the options in the UI.

b50e2244_4be5_01a1_eaf4_5dd42d15b023.title: value
b50e2244_4be5_01a1_eaf4_5dd42d15b023.description:
The element's value as an array of selected multiple choice options.
**Matching order** The order of the objects in the array matches the order of the options in the UI.

be845896_f1ab_0137_599a_baaaa039edf6.title: sitemap_locations
be845896_f1ab_0137_599a_baaaa039edf6.description: A list of sitemap locations that the content item is in.

c3a6e8a6_c1cf_01a6_2ffa_912a5f9746dd.title: message
c3a6e8a6_c1cf_01a6_2ffa_912a5f9746dd.description: The error message explaining what caused the error.
examples: The requested content item 'sample_item' was not found.

c48d826c_eee6_01c5_ab7f_a7a3e628b77b.title: renditions
c48d826c_eee6_01c5_ab7f_a7a3e628b77b.description: The image's rendition. Contains query parameters that need to be concatenated with the original asset's URL to apply image customization.

content_item.title: Content item
content_item.description: The content item with metadata and individual elements.

d36c0980_518d_0131_c827_7f981505b3f1.title: languages
d36c0980_518d_0131_c827_7f981505b3f1.description: Active languages available in the project.

d3aae50a_093d_01a8_ac85_79708b6fb958.title: name
d3aae50a_093d_01a8_ac85_79708b6fb958.description: The multiple choice option's display name.

d5219c26_c891_01bb_7dc2_152875475f99.title: last_modified
d5219c26_c891_01bb_7dc2_152875475f99.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601 "International standard covering the exchange of date- and time-related data") formatted date-time of the last content type change.

da34bfc2_84d6_01a9_cc2d_50f0562dc893.title: value
da34bfc2_84d6_01a9_cc2d_50f0562dc893.description:
The linked pages as an array of item codenames.
**Matching order** The order of the codenames in the array matches the order of the content items in the UI. The content of these items can be found in the `modular_content` property (where the items are not ordered) of the API response when getting content items.

dc29b58e_29fd_0127_5700_7a2d4e1579ed.title: total_count
dc29b58e_29fd_0127_5700_7a2d4e1579ed.description:
The total number of objects matching the query.

The property is present only when [listing content items](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/4fafdf10-32c6-4020-a91a-cf1f835f8107) and using the `includeTotalCount` query parameter.

e443609c_b6bf_01e4_c22e_62d49bb01108.title: next_page
e443609c_b6bf_01e4_c22e_62d49bb01108.description: A URL to the next page of results.

e5d6559f_a8c0_014f_d978_5e36ab28c38c.title: query
e5d6559f_a8c0_014f_d978_5e36ab28c38c.description: Parameters set for the image rendition.

e7549085_1471_0157_8b36_056b3cd2eb0d.title: elements
e7549085_1471_0157_8b36_056b3cd2eb0d.description:
A list of [elements](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ea9768d1-bd2f-4027-bb5e-5cd9c85ea360) that define the content type.
**Order may not match the order in UI** The order of the elements in the API response might not match their order in the UI.

ec13646a_1f2d_0144_0d58_2f0e7fa34819.title: language
ec13646a_1f2d_0144_0d58_2f0e7fa34819.description:
The codename of the language that the content is in.

For details on retrieving content in different languages, see [Getting localized content](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/bf83b286-9972-4e65-8db9-412ca17df944).

ec32f6e9_dce7_01e1_3f8b_e3030ecd640d.title: elements
ec32f6e9_dce7_01e1_3f8b_e3030ecd640d.description:
The item's [elements](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ea9768d1-bd2f-4027-bb5e-5cd9c85ea360) with values for the specific language.
The order of the element objects might not match the content element order in the UI.

f638f48f_c686_01e4_262e_1d478ca901c2.title: limit
f638f48f_c686_01e4_262e_1d478ca901c2.description: The number of objects returned in the response. Reflects the value specified by the `limit` query parameter.

ff42d3fe_938a_0195_ef84_cba27d460536.title: skip
ff42d3fe_938a_0195_ef84_cba27d460536.description: The number of objects skipped from the response. Reflects the value specified by the `skip` query parameter.

n04369c15_ba95_01da_37da_1af4b10cce5b.title: type
n04369c15_ba95_01da_37da_1af4b10cce5b.description: The codename of the item's type.

n05eaa583_bd38_0159_ad2b_53425d57ad98.title: description
n05eaa583_bd38_0159_ad2b_53425d57ad98.description: The image's description in a specific language. Used for the alt attribute of an `` tag.
examples: Person sitting on a wooden pier

n08d30341_9167_0162_a788_351865251b8c.title: codename
n08d30341_9167_0162_a788_351865251b8c.description: Codename of the content type, generated from the content types's {~name~}.

n241fbd59_29cb_01eb_ff6f_a68beacb3469.title: error_code
n241fbd59_29cb_01eb_ff6f_a68beacb3469.description: The specific internal code for the type of error. Only useful for finding patterns among error requests.

n299aa40d_79a2_01b8_c5ef_7887bd6d2c0a.title: modular_content
n299aa40d_79a2_01b8_c5ef_7887bd6d2c0a.description:
Contains codenames of the [components and content items](#section/Rich-text-element/modular-content-components-and-items-in-rich-text) (not their contents) inserted into the rich text element. To get the contents of the inserted components and items, see how to [retrieve linked content](#tag/Linked-content-and-components/retrieve-linked-content).
**Two distinct** `modular_content` **properties** In the `modular_content` object property of the Delivery API response, you can find the contents of the linked content items and content components. In the rich text element's [modular_content array property](#section/Rich-text-element/modular-content-components-and-items-in-rich-text), you can find the codenames of the inserted content items and content components. The codenames in the rich text's `modular_content` array are grouped and ordered. First comes a group of item codenames followed by a group of component codenames. The order of codenames in each group matches that in the UI.

n2afde4b9_b613_019b_a4fc_6b1b91d161cb.title: name
n2afde4b9_b613_019b_a4fc_6b1b91d161cb.description: The multiple choice option's display name.

n2c51ca3f_cac8_018e_b336_8c8fbdb710e9.title: value
n2c51ca3f_cac8_018e_b336_8c8fbdb710e9.description:
The linked content items as an array of item codenames.
**Matching order** The order of the codenames in the array matches the order of the content items in the UI. The content of these items can be found in the `modular_content` property (where the items are not ordered) of the API response when getting content items.

n2cade906_1457_018e_7704_f42a707f3471.title: name
n2cade906_1457_018e_7704_f42a707f3471.description: Display name of the content type.

n2d9fceeb_6d2b_01e2_e624_b1f15542a80a.title: last_modified
n2d9fceeb_6d2b_01e2_e624_b1f15542a80a.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601 "International standard covering the exchange of date- and time-related data") formatted date-time of the last change to the taxonomy group.

n34796a2c_0bb2_01fb_90bd_34fea348e4ac.title: specific_code
n34796a2c_0bb2_01fb_90bd_34fea348e4ac.description: Only useful for finding reasons behind failed requests in specific cases.

n34c86c6a_8adc_01bc_a366_3840459bbfa2.title: modular_content
n34c86c6a_8adc_01bc_a366_3840459bbfa2.description: A list of components used in rich text elements. See [Linked content and components](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/286dbb0e-f673-494f-abfd-3f39c7ec3446) for more details.

n3a3f3c37_ae28_01f5_e0a1_3e50b0bd6939.title: description
n3a3f3c37_ae28_01f5_e0a1_3e50b0bd6939.description: The asset's description for a specific language.
examples: Description of what the asset represents.

n3c1b7401_a647_0125_17d8_c45daf22c2ae.title: height
n3c1b7401_a647_0125_17d8_c45daf22c2ae.description: The image's height in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

n3f1e6092_2cfd_010e_c182_91f1ce1ae48f.title: value
n3f1e6092_2cfd_010e_c182_91f1ce1ae48f.description: The element's value can be either auto-generated from a text element or custom.

n42ba353d_3294_0138_d089_639a70903b1c.title: collection
n42ba353d_3294_0138_d089_639a70903b1c.description: The content item's [collection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f48c2c0b-755f-4d23-bd5d-7201fe5fff01) codename. For projects without collections enabled, the value is `default`.

n4888c598_5682_016d_6ee0_7b3fe27f0f30.title: value
n4888c598_5682_016d_6ee0_7b3fe27f0f30.description:
The element's value.
If the element does not contain any content, its value defaults to a single empty paragraph: `


`.
examples:
Basic formatted text: plain text, bold, italics, monospace, subscript, superscript.

Links: link to a content item, link to web URL, email link, link to asset.

Table

ABC
DEF
GHI

Image

Inserted content item

Component

n50d05ee1_1499_01d1_3601_d3428770372d.title: type
n50d05ee1_1499_01d1_3601_d3428770372d.description: The codename of the linked item's type.

n65511815_0234_0167_426d_936d42212e82.title: last_modified
n65511815_0234_0167_426d_936d42212e82.description:
[ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last change to user-content of the content item.
Moving content items through workflow doesn't affect the `last_modified` value.

n66efeb9b_e806_0131_366d_cbbd1bd01d0a.title: value
n66efeb9b_e806_0131_366d_cbbd1bd01d0a.description: The element's value as a [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted string. Time in this element is displayed and interpreted as [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated%5FUniversal%5FTime "Coordinated Universal Time").

n6752d10e_4532_010a_61bb_7431b182601c.title: terms
n6752d10e_4532_010a_61bb_7431b182601c.description: A list of descendant taxonomy terms.

n6ce5d58b_48ca_013f_e09a_ddb613926947.title: id
n6ce5d58b_48ca_013f_e09a_ddb613926947.description: Unique internal identifier of the content type.

n6e35639e_97e5_017c_f0dd_1e7a64845015.title: taxonomy_group
n6e35639e_97e5_017c_f0dd_1e7a64845015.description: The codename of a specific taxonomy group that the element is using.

n6fd41e65_c66c_0146_98df_b6decc975691.title: links
n6fd41e65_c66c_0146_98df_b6decc975691.description: The hyperlinks in the text that point to content items. Each [link object](#section/Rich-text-element/links-single-object) contains the linked item's metadata.

n76613773_c3a6_0128_e64a_0dc7eab43fb4.title: value
n76613773_c3a6_0128_e64a_0dc7eab43fb4.description: The element's value as an array of selected taxonomy terms.

n7bc5c917_c2b2_0181_211b_f6bcb157efe8.title: codename
n7bc5c917_c2b2_0181_211b_f6bcb157efe8.description: The content item's codename. By default, generated from the item's display name.

n7ec6482b_faa3_01fc_c09d_f4c663f3e34a.title: count
n7ec6482b_faa3_01fc_c09d_f4c663f3e34a.description:
The number of retrieved objects.

If the `limit` and `skip` query parameters are not specified, the `count` property reflects the total number of objects in the project.

n7f17c88d_5421_01ac_123d_ac9be6c3ef00.title: workflow_step
n7f17c88d_5421_01ac_123d_ac9be6c3ef00.description:
The codename of the item's current workflow step. By default, generated from the workflow step's display name.

This property is not present for [components](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/286dbb0e-f673-494f-abfd-3f39c7ec3446).

n8a79a2ad_2122_01b1_4587_f83ac23192fd.title: value
n8a79a2ad_2122_01b1_4587_f83ac23192fd.description:
The assets inserted into the element. The asset objects are returned in the same order as shown in the UI.

Some of the properties are specific to images only: `width` and `height` represent the image's width and height dimensions and the `renditions` object contains details about [customized images](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/41122488-31c5-47ba-8444-05a3e87d10a0).

To display customized images on the website or an app, you first need to apply custom query parameters to the asset's original URL.

n8dcd81b5_d9f7_0109_c079_592bae454564.title: url_slug
n8dcd81b5_d9f7_0109_c079_592bae454564.description: The content item's URL slug. If the linked item doesn't use a URL slug element, the value of the {~url_slug~} property is an empty string.

n8e725eed_82c1_0148_b93b_07931e06d3c9.title: images
n8e725eed_82c1_0148_b93b_07931e06d3c9.description: The images inserted into the rich text element. Each [image object](#section/Rich-text-element/images-single-object) contains the image's metadata.

n92ef070f_a98a_0171_52eb_b644664978be.title: width
n92ef070f_a98a_0171_52eb_b644664978be.description: The image's width in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

n9e2e211c_634f_01bb_4d2c_989d09089414.title: taxonomy_group
n9e2e211c_634f_01bb_4d2c_989d09089414.description: The codename of a specific taxonomy group that the element is using.

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.description: Information about the current page of results.

rich_text_image_object.title: Rich text image
rich_text_image_object.description: The name of the object represents an image id, such as {~14mio~}.

rich_text_link_object.title: Rich text link
rich_text_link_object.description: The name of the object represents a content item ID, such as {~f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474~}.

untitled_content_item_4b71df4.title: rendition
untitled_content_item_4b71df4.description: The name of the object represents an image preset's codename. Currently, there's only one default preset that holds the [customized image](/tutorials/write-and-collaborate/create-content/work-with-media#a-customize-assets-for-a-better-fit).

depth.name: depth
depth.description:
Determines the level of nesting for content items that the API returns. By default, only the first level of linked items is returned, which is the same as setting {~depth=1~}. If you want to include more than one level of linked items in response, set the {~depth~} query parameter to {~2~} or more. If you need to exclude all linked items from the response, set the parameter to {~0~}.
Components are always present in response. See Linked content and components for more details.

element_codename.name: element_codename
element_codename.description:
Identifies the element by codename within the specified content type.
The element's codename has no relation to the type of the element.

elements.name: elements
elements.description:
Determines the elements to retrieve using a comma-separated list of element codenames. The {~elements~} query parameter applies to all content items within the response.

If not specified, all elements are retrieved. For more details, see [Projection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/c4552a2f-142c-4415-b7aa-f2c5b165a84e).

example.Error: Invalid json. Content item codename: 'array_of_strings'. Content item name: 'Array of strings'

includetotalcount.name: includeTotalCount
includetotalcount.description:
Adds the information about the total number of content items matching your query. Only [the content filtering parameters](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) affect the resulting number. Other parameters in your query, such as `limit,` `skip`, or `order`, don't have an effect on it.

The number doesn't include linked items returned as part of the `modular_content` property. For the total number of items returned within the response, see the `X-Request-Charge` header.

When set to `true`, the pagination object returned in the API response contains an additional `total_count` property.

item_codename.name: item_codename
item_codename.description: Identifies the content item by codename.

language.name: language
language.description:
Determines which language variant of content items to return. By default, the API returns content in the default language.
If the requested content is not available in the specified language variant, the API follows the language fallbacks as configured in the Localization settings of your project.

limit_8cd54e2.name: limit
limit_8cd54e2.description:
Sets the number of objects to retrieve in a single request. If the `limit` parameter is not specified, the API returns all requested objects by default.

If `limit` is lower than the total number of objects matching your query, the `next_page` property in the `pagination` object of the API response will contain a URL to the next page of results.

The `limit` parameter affects only the number of items in the `items` property. It doesn't reduce the number of linked items in the `modular_content` property so you may hit the [response size limit](#section/Response-size) unexpectedly. You can set `depth=0` to avoid that.

order.name: order
order.description:
Determines the order of the retrieved objects. By default, the objects are sorted alphabetically by their codenames from A to Z in descending order.

To sort the requested objects in ascending order, set the `order` to `<property_name>[asc]` where `<property_name>` is the name of the object property you want to sort by. For example, `order=elements.title[asc]` or `order=system.codename[asc]`. Similarly, to sort in descending order, use the `[desc]` modifier. You can sort by any properties in the API response.

**Examples**

* Sort by date – `order=system.last_modified[desc]`
* Sort by a content item name – `order=system.name[asc]`
* Sort by an element value – `order=elements.<element_codename>[asc]`

project_id.name: project_id
project_id.description:
Identifies your project.

If you're using [environments](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/a814879f-64a2-4689-8a99-e4e98cdf60ba), the project ID becomes environment ID and specifies one of the project's environments.

skip.name: skip
skip.description:
Sets the number of objects to skip when requesting a list of objects. The `skip` parameter must be combined with the `limit` parameter to work. If `skip` is not specified, the API returns the first page of results.

You can combine the `limit` and `skip` parameters to specify page size and page number. For example, using `limit=10&skip=10` sets the page size to 10 and gets the second page of results.

taxonomy_group_codename.name: taxonomy_group_codename
taxonomy_group_codename.description: Identifies the taxonomy group by codename.

type_codename.name: type_codename
type_codename.description: Identifies the content type by codename.

x_continuation.name: X-Continuation
x_continuation.description:
Determines the next page of results to retrieve. By default, when the header is not set, the API returns the first page of results.

If there are more items to enumerate, the response will come with the {~X-Continuation~} header. To get the next page of results, use the {~X-Continuation~} header from the response in your request.

x_kc_wait_for_loading_new_content.name: X-KC-Wait-For-Loading-New-Content
x_kc_wait_for_loading_new_content.description:
Determines whether the API waits while fetching content, if the requested content has changed since the last request. This is useful when retrieving changed content in reaction to a [webhook](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/5b87f0a1-c271-449d-a9dc-04f995c89589) call.

By default, when the header is not set, the API serves stale content (if cached by the CDN) while it's fetching the new content to minimize wait time. To always fetch new content, set the header value to {~true~}.

x_request_charge.name: X-Request-Charge
x_request_charge.description:
Specifies the number of content items returned in the response. This number covers both the items that directly match the specified query and the linked items returned in the response's `modular_content` property.

If the `X-Request-Charge` value of your requests exceeds 1000, we recommend applying more specific [filters](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6cf1d73-471a-4f1e-b0a9-f0e041e2d905) and checking if a lower value for the [`depth` parameter](#tag/Linked-content-and-components/linked-content-depth) works for you. Fewer items returned per response means shorter response times and better performance for your app.

body_copy.name: Body
body_copy.value:
The 3 most important things when writing error messages

  1. Don’t abuse alerts for upselling or showing superfluous information. People will stop reading the messages that are actually important.
  2. Don’t just assume people know about the context of a message. They might toggle between apps and see your message days after it happened. Always include enough information for users to make sense of it.
  3. Use a friendly, non-technical, non-threatening tone of voice.

TL;DR Write actionable error messages that laypeople can understand.*

*Not sure if they do? Show them to a non-technical person and ask them to explain it back to you.

Read the full story on Medium.

body.value:
Quisque erat nisl, elementum ac consectetur eu, vulputate id metus. Cras placerat odio est, eu elementum eros pretium id. Donec a ornare dui. Pellentesque porta sed lorem eu accumsan. Pellentesque at dui ut urna gravida volutpat finibus sit amet leo. Duis et tempus nulla.

Nullam odio ante, blandit ut posuere eu, eleifend vitae dui. Mauris sagittis, tortor et tempor eleifend, enim libero tempus velit, non hendrerit lacus sem eu lorem. Nulla cursus eu ante nec pulvinar.

Nulla in facilisis tortor, quis pretium tortor. Vivamus quis laoreet nisi, non egestas massa. Maecenas hendrerit massa leo. Maecenas convallis dui vitae lorem suscipit efficitur. Maecenas vel dignissim erat, fringilla luctus lorem. Vivamus hendrerit ante et accumsan fringilla. Nullam quis pellentesque erat.
